caption:
This photograph captures a serene, yet dynamic scene at a misty waterside location. It features a person, presumably a fisherman, wading in a body of choppy water. The fisherman, wearing a black and red plaid jacket and dark trousers or waders, is partly facing the camera and bending forward, using a fishing net with his right hand, while holding another net in his left hand.

Above and around the fisherman, numerous seagulls are in mid-flight, adding a lively element to the scene. These birds appear active and engaged, possibly attracted by the activity in the water or by the presence of the fisherman.

The background is obscured by a thick mist or fog, creating a monochromatic grey-blue tone that blankets the entire scene, providing a sense of isolation and calm amid the activity. The atmosphere evokes a sense of chilliness and dampness, typical of misty seaside or lakeside settings early in the morning or during cooler weather. The overall composition of the photo, with its misty aesthetic and the contrasting motion of birds, creates a poignant snapshot of human interaction with nature in a tranquil environment.
title: Smelt run at Tawas City. (From the sites exhibition. For other images in this assignment, see fiche numbers 149, 150, 151, 152, 153.)
